clinical_study.brief_title: Factors Influencing Risk of Progression of Chronic Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Factors Influencing Risk of Progression of Chronic Kidney Disease in Patients With Severe Renal Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to identify typical patterns of renal function evolution in patients with stage 4 chronic kidney disease, regularly followed in nephrology consultation and included in a French cohort.

primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) according to MDRD equation (modification of diet in renal disease) at each visit
Time between inclusion and occurrence of the "progression" event
primary_outcome.description: progression: initiation of an extra-renal purification technique or reduction of GFR of at least 5 mL / min / 1.73m2 compared to inclusion in FAIR-PROGRESS

study_pop.textblock: Adult population with chronic renal failure, before replacement therapy, followed in 9 nephrology departments of Bourgogne Franche-Comté.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients meeting the inclusion criteria of the ND-CRIS cohort (long-term follow-up in one of the centers participating in the research, with a GFR <60mL/min /1.73m2)
- Patients included in the ND-CRIS cohort on the date when the estimate of their GFR is strictly less than 30mL/min/1.73m2 and greater than or equal to 15mL/min/1.73m2 (MDRD equation).
Patients should have at least two measurements of GFR <30mL/min/1.73m2 to be included, at least one of them greater than or equal to 15mL/min/1.73m2. The date of the first GFR <30mL/min/ 1.73m2 will be considered as the date of origin.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with GFR ≥30mL / min / 1.73m2 or <15mL / min / 1.73m2
- Patients who do not meet the inclusion criteria of ND-CRIS cohort (dialysis patients, transplant patients, unfollowed patients)
